title: Mali: France halts development aid amid growing isolation of Bamako
description: After Sweden and Egypt, the United Kingdom and Côte d'Ivoire announced the withdrawal of their peacekeepers from the UN Minusma mission.

title: Basketball star Brittney Griner begins sentence in a remote Russian prison
description: On Monday, US and Russian spy chiefs held a rare face-to-face meeting in Ankara on Americans held prisoner by the Kremlin

title: US: Fired employees accuse SpaceX of violating labor law
description: The complaint, made on Wednesday, details what allegedly happened after SpaceX employees circulated a letter in June, which called on executives to condemn Elon Musk's public behavior on Twitter.

title: Ticketmaster cancels next Taylor Swift concert ticket sale
description: The ticketing company cited 'extraordinarily high demands on ticketing systems and insufficient remaining ticket inventory to meet that demand' as a reason for calling off Friday's sale.

title: Thousands of Russian prisoners are sent to the front line in Ukraine
description: The prisoners are recruited personally by Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Wagner mercenaries. Very few escape.

title: Senegalese star Sadio Mané ruled out of World Cup with injury
description: The Bayern Munich forward was racing to recover frim a fibula injury in his last match before the tournament in Qatar.

title: Voices in Sharm el-Sheikh call for world leaders to attend COP15 on biodiversity
description: The architects of the 2015 Paris Agreement and NGOs are stressing the need for reaching an ambitious agreement in Canada this December.

title: French Holocaust denier to remain in custody in Scotland
description: Vincent Reynouard was arrested in Scotland after fleeing France, where he was convicted of Holocaust denial six times.

title: 'Made in China' Paris Olympics mascots disappoint French
description: Only 8% of the 'Phryges' mascots modeled on a revolutionary symbol will be manufactured in France.

title: Nancy Pelosi won't seek Democratic leadership role in US House
description: The only woman ever elected as House speaker will not seek election to the position of minority leader. But she plans to stay in Congress.

title: French prime minister struggles to embody environmental planning
description: Six months into her term, Elisabeth Borne still has to step out of President Macron's shadow on environmental issues and must now defend three bills before Parliament.

title: Terrorist attack in Turkey revives plans for military intervention in northern Syria
description: A few days after Istanbul's famous Istiklal Avenue was hit by a terrorist attack, which Ankara blames on the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK), Turkish officials hinted at a new military operation in Syria.

title: Youth vote blocked a 'red wave' in the US midterms, exit polls show
description: Nearly 27% of those under 30 cast their vote in the US midterm elections. An unusually high rate, which thwarted the Republican camp's widely expected victory.

title: Dutch court convicts 3 men over murder of 298 people onboard flight MH17
description: The verdict comes more than eight years after the Boeing 777 flight flying from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur was blown out of the sky over Ukraine. Two Russians and a Ukrainian were convicted and one was acquitted over the downing.

title: British government unveils austerity budget despite recession
description: The United Kingdom is bringing back austerity, with UK Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt likening himself to the penny-pinching Charles Dickens character, Ebenezer Scrooge.

title: Amid a looming recession, the UK housing market feels the bite of skyrocketing interest rates
description: British homeowners are worried they may not be able to pay for their loans after UK interest rate rises hit mortgages.

title: COP27: Brazil's Lula brings new hope for the fight against climate change
description: Welcomed like a rock star at COP27 in Egypt, Brazil's president-elect promised to stop deforestation in the Amazon and offered to host the 2025 world climate conference.

title: Qatar World cup: 'We must not politicize sport', Macron says
description: The competition will kick off on Sunday as its host, Qatar, is accused of human rights abuse.

title: 'Like rape and the destruction of power plants, culture is another weapon of war for Russia'
description: The looting of museums by the Russian occupation forces is a new example of the ultimate objective pursued by Vladimir Putin: To erase the Ukrainian identity, says journalist Sylvie Kauffmann in her column.

title: Midterms 2022: With a House majority, Republicans plan to lay siege to the White House
description: Having passed the 218 mark on Wednesday, the Republicans have wrested a fragile majority eight days after the midterm elections.

title: War in Ukraine: Strikes hit Odesa region, Dnipro city
description: It was the first time in weeks strikes had hit Ukraine's southern Odesa region and the city of Dnipro in what seems to be the latest Russian mass strike on the country.

title: Xi angrily confronts Trudeau over 'leaks' about Canada-China relations
description: The Chinese president openly rebuked the Canadian prime minister at the G20 meeting in Indonesia for sharing details of a meeting regarding Chinese interference.

title: Kevin Spacey faces further UK sex offense charges
description: UK police say the actor is accused of a number of offenses against one man, who has emerged as fourth complainant.

title: In Africa, fossil fuel exploitation is extremely focussed on the needs of the West
description: According to a report published at COP27, two-thirds of the new projects developed on the continent are carried out by foreign multinationals and the majority are for export.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile after warning of 'fiercer' military response
description: The latest missile comes on the back of expanded military exercises between the US and South Korea.

title: France hesitates over regularization of undocumented workers
description: The French government announced the creation of a 'residence permit for in-demand occupations', but is hesitating after backlash from the right on this historically complex topic.

title: Feelings run high over the closure of a Pyrenees mountain pass to Spain
description: The Col de Banyuls-sur-Mer border crossing between France and Spain has been closed since 2020, a move some say is damaging the local economy and cross-border ties.

title: French government trapped by its own rhetoric on immigration
description: In France, the near-systematic issuing of deportation orders means that the enforcement rate is low. But the government insists its method is efficient.

title: Two inmates convicted of murder executed in Arizona and Texas
description: Two death row inmates convicted of murder were executed Wednesday in the United States. Both executions used lethal injection.

title: 'I'm a Celebrity,' the reality show that is making a splash in Westminster
description: Boris Johnson's former health minister, Matt Hancock has appeared in the show that puts survival skills to the test in the Australian jungle. His participation has provoked some outrage among British politicians, but also a real craze.

title: In the UK, Just Stop Oil's activism is still going strong despite police repression
description: Since April 1, almost 2,000 activists belonging to the movement have been arrested by the police and 16 are currently serving prison sentences for public disorder.

title: Landmark same-sex marriage bill advances in US Senate
description: A dozen Republicans joined all 50 Democrats in the chamber in clearing a procedural hurdle so the bill can move on to the full Senate. This puts the Congress on track to take the historic step of ensuring that same-sex unions are enshrined in federal law.
